title: Is LMMS a good DAW? - Quora

response.answer_text: Nope, it’s missing a lot of features compared to industry standard DAWs, for example decent automation editing and stable VST support. Tracktion 7 is pretty objectively a better free option. I used LMMS as a first DAW, but that was years ago when it was the best thing available for free. Things have changed a lot since then. If Tracktion 7 doesn’t float your boat, you may want to check out Cakewalk by Bandlab, which in my opinion isn’t as well refined, but it may suit your needs. You’ll want to try T7 first though.

Sure, it’s one of the best free ones I think! Even though it does lack some features, it won’t prevent you from completing a track if you only intend to use digital audio and not live (you can’t record live in that DAW). It has come a long way and is open-source, so I think it will be going a lot further. Here is a tutorial to not only help you get started but to check it out so you can see if you like it.
